alert.note: Alert for Essex (Vermont) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 09 at 4:50PM EDT until July 09 at 6:15PM EDT by NWS Burlington
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 615 PM EDT THIS EVENING FOR CENTRAL ESSEX COUNTY... At 450 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Maidstone State Park, Maidstone, Granby, Brunswick, Guildhall, Ferdinand, East Haven, Bloomfield, Lunenburg, Victory, Lewis, Lemington, Concord, Averill, Brunswick Springs and South Lunenburg. A trained spotter in Lunenburg reported 1.70 inches of rainfall so far. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are likely in portions of the warned area. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
